intro: Wislizenia, commonly known as blisterweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the sunflower family (Asteraceae). It is native to North America and is characterized by its branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits called cypsela, which are covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Wislizenia is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in fields and along roadsides.
